questions.question: Who were the first set of consuls elected for 65?
options: C. Cornelius Scipio and M. Tullius Cicero
L. Manlius Torquatus and L. Aurelius Cotta
P. Autroneius Paetus and P. Cornelius Sulla
M. Licinius Crassus and G. Julius Caesar

questions.question: What were these consuls prosecuted for, resulting in their removal from the senate and the consulship?
Who was elected in the further elections to replace them?
options: G. Calpurnius Piso and M. Licinius Crassus
L. Manlius Torquatus and L. Aurelius Cotta
M. Tullius Cicero and L. Aurelius Cotta
L. Aemilius Paullus and M. Lucullus

questions.question: Why was Catiline rejected from his bid to run for consul?
options: He had been accused of embezzlement
He was from an unimportant family
He was part of an ongoing trial
He was involved in a rebellion

questions.question: Which disgraced consul formed a plot, and who was his main co-conspirator?
What was the initial plan of these conspirators?
options: They would seize the treasury and assassinate the senators
The conspirators would create a new government
Autronius and Catiline would be consuls, and Piso would take power in Spain

questions.question: After rumours of this plot surfaced, what did they change their plan to?
options: To overthrow the government and establish a dictatorship

questions.question: Which figures does Cicero implicate in the plot?
Which sources provide accounts of this plot?
options: Cicero, pro Muerna; pro Sulla; Sallust, Bellum Catinilinae; Livy, Periochae; Suetonius, Julius Caesar; Cassius Dio

questions.question: Which author implicates Crassus and Caesar in the plot?
Which alleged potential victim of the plot later defended Catiline in his trial, and stated he did not believe the rumours?
Which figure considered acting as Catiline's defense in the trial, and later considered running alongside him for consul?
What happened to the proposed enquiry into the conspiracy?
options: It was carried out and the conspirators were executed

questions.question: What did the senate vote to put in place once the conspiracy was discovered?
options: A special commission to arrest the conspirators
